newsitem.title: MEXICO: BOXING-JUDGE ORDERS ARREST OF CHAVEZ.
newsitem.headline: BOXING-JUDGE ORDERS ARREST OF CHAVEZ.

text.p: A Mexican judge has ordered the arrest of former world champion boxer Julio Cesar Chavez on tax fraud charges, the Finance Ministry said on Monday.
Mexican Chavez and his business partners in his home state of Sinaloa failed to pay some 10.58 million pesos ($1.39 million) in taxes to the government, according to the ministry.

Tax officials have been auditing Chavez's tax records for more than a year. He has denied any wrongdoing and said his former business partners, family and friends have betrayed him in order to get at his money.
Chavez lost his WBC super-lightweight title to American Oscar De La Hoya in Las Vegas on June 7. He was stopped in the fourth round.
